entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Southerly winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Cold, showery conditions could bring snow flurries down to 500 m at times about the Remutaka summit. 1 cm or less may accumulate on the road about the summit tonight and early Wednesday morning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow showers continue to affect areas east of the summit down to 400 metres until Tuesday evening and another 1 to 2 cm may accumulate at times above 500m with lesser amounts lower down.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow showers are expected to affect the road above 700 metres this afternoon and evening, mainly in the south. 2 to 4 cm may accumulate on the road about and south of the summit, with lesser amounts further north. Snow flurries may continue through to Wednesday afternoon.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow showers are expected to affect the road above 700 metres from this evening until early Wednesday morning. 1 to 2 cm may accumulate about the higher parts of the road. Snow flurries may continue in the east through to Wednesday afternoon.
